intro: Psychotria gyrulosa, commonly known as the golden psychotria, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its striking yellow flowers, which are often clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are typically elliptical with a glossy surface and a slightly serrated edge. Psychotria gyrulosa is often found in shaded, humid environments and plays a role in supporting local biodiversity.
